commitmsg: fix a couple bugs with the bookmarklet, add todo
fix headers
add a readme
initial work
Added video/screencast
another typo in url rewrite
typo
Use :8080 on the viewer when deployed
Ignore another setAttribute error
Added in experimental rtc jetpack module
Split off web site/HTML client from the addon client.  Fix up the front page.  Hidden user and login support
Change to node server
Fix addon chatting
Trim/fix homepage and make XPI installable

Change communication between iframes embedded in the addon, which must use events to signal back.
Make PostMessage channels easier to bind and unbind, for the purpose of reseting on a window change.
Refactor mirror.js into master.js and client.js, with domutils.js for some extra stuff.
Misc fixes and refactorings.
catch errors (happens when there's a recursive structure)
try to refactor rtc/audio stuff to make it work in the addon (but still doesn't work)
updates to make channels work in addon context
Make styling of chat messages consistent across client/server
get rid of Master's shareUrl, that is no longer used
Extract the freeze code into its own module.  Remove a bunch of stuff from mirror.js that referred to now-deprecated in-process UI, or other code that is dead.
clean up console.logs
Poll for back button, since tab.on(ready) doesn't work in that case.  Change to use a formally local message system for chats and other messages from mirror.js to container
Add toString's to channels.  Fix postMessage problem where we didn't filter messages
Refactoring of the modules, of all communication, add more layers (with several iframes) to separate out UI concerns, and to support RTC layers
Add some experimental iframe support
Clean up proxy worker binding.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:mozilla/browsermirror
Listen on public port by default.  increase configured max frame size
Resurrect wsecho.js and keep it more persistent
Put in Node.js server. Get rid of wsecho.js (or comment out for now)
Add an intermediary so that websockets are always same-origin
A couple more debugging statements
Improved some of the debugging messages
Add new files from Tornado upgrade
Upgrade Tornado.  Remove script-fixup stuff from the many scripty things Tornado installs

Allow share names to contain most characters.
Default to new mirror address.
Allow the share location to be fixed.
Add some more error handling.
Keep track of master/mirror in connection.
Full refactoring of BrowserMirror for use as an addon
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:mozilla/browsermirror
add some more items
Move stuff around to a Jetpack-style layout
forgot argument to removeEventListener
forgot addEventListener argument
Send keydown/keyup events on keypress.  Cancel share link click fast
note repo move
Show a little note when mirror is connected with no master.  Once master connects ask for document right away.

Give a warning if there are two masters.
Ask about following any links when the mirror clicks on a link.
Make clicking on hashed links works a bit better.
Reload the page quickly in the mirror when the master href has changed.  Fixes #9.  Reorder the way things are set slightly, try to set important things (e.g., base href) first.
recalculate the other screen arrow less often
fix the share link on the mirror
a few more notes
Make the share link open a text field when clicked
take out the useless wikipedia bookmarklet link
show video automatically with #video
link to video
Fix Chrome issue where it responds to initKeyboardEvent, not initKeyEvent; fire keyup when a field change happens; get field changes on keyup, not on change (change only fires after blur)
avoid serializing event attributes that are objects (e.g., currentTarget, which points to the document, which has no jsmirrorId)
ignore some invalid requests
added a couple more diff tests
make the panel a bit smaller
add small diff test
don't catch ctrl-n
Fixed problem with sending append diffs
send the doc immediately on hello
make the buttons 1em wide on Chrome
fix the display of the remote screen a bit
Add new diff command to just change the text of an element.  Handle clicks on elements inside an <a>.  Don't re-send the screen position if it doesn't change.
fix case when tracker has no marks

Remove and re-display ranges when a diff comes in.
Avoid keeping elements on master forever, so deleted elements can be GC'd.
Fix bug in applying diffs.
Make the chat panel wider.
Implement traffic tracking.
Add a new way of doing diffs (not yet complete)
fix the way updates are sent
Send incremental updates of the page, instead of always sending the complete page.  Switch to always-xhr-polling because that's all I can get to work reliably
fix button color changes
note range view
make the style a bit more attractive
fix a selection case
Handle reconnects more gracefully.  Firefox with WebSockets results in more reconnects, most notably
Added a bunch more helpful text
set WEB_SOCKET_SWF_LOCATION in the server.  Include WebSocketMainInsecure.swf directly (cross-origin flashsocket)
Send screen position both directions.  Fix screen size calculation.  Make screen size button show where the other person is looking
Show the screen on the master computer
Fix event highlight calculation (was broken on google.com)
abort setDoc when reloading
resend full doc more often
added some more front-page notes
Abstract out keypresses non-catching some, make sure they are all working.  Make lazy updates a bit more granular.
fix addEventListener call
avoid console[method].apply on Fennec
a little more careful with console.log
Fire DOM0 events.  Serialize canvas tags to images for remote
fix some cases of screen range sending not working
Make some null ranges not display.  Get select boxes to work better as input fields and trigger change events
Put in a marker in the chat log that will replay a marker
Show where the master is scrolled to (not symmetric currently, doesn't work on master)

Avoid Flash when cross-domain.  Fix click event propagation.  Avoid killing the websocket flash container in the mirror.  Make highlighting a circle, with pixel offsets.  Add a button that's not yet used in the chat window.
Make the session URL persist with the bookmarklet, not just window.name
General refactoring and renaming of components.  Serialize and send selection ranges to mirror.  Fix the case when an update truncates an element, and when it changes individual text nodes.
Better command-line help
fixed a chat bug
Switch to using internal logging functions.  Make the token sticky in the bookmarklet.  Fix the highlighting listener turn-ff
avoid some long console messages
add -h and look in $IO_BASE
Move to socket.io and a Node server
fix some things about highlighting
Added video/screencast
another typo in url rewrite
typo
Use :8080 on the viewer when deployed
Ignore another setAttribute error
Added in experimental rtc jetpack module
Split off web site/HTML client from the addon client.  Fix up the front page.  Hidden user and login support
Change to node server
Fix addon chatting
Trim/fix homepage and make XPI installable

try to refactor rtc/audio stuff to make it work in the addon (but still doesn't work)
updates to make channels work in addon context
Make styling of chat messages consistent across client/server
get rid of Master's shareUrl, that is no longer used

clean up console.logs

Add toString's to channels.  Fix postMessage problem where we didn't filter messages
Refactoring of the modules, of all communication, add more layers (with several iframes) to separate out UI concerns, and to support RTC layers
Add some experimental iframe support
Clean up proxy worker binding.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:mozilla/browsermirror
Listen on public port by default.  increase configured max frame size
Resurrect wsecho.js and keep it more persistent
Put in Node.js server. Get rid of wsecho.js (or comment out for now)
Add an intermediary so that websockets are always same-origin
A couple more debugging statements
Improved some of the debugging messages
Add new files from Tornado upgrade
Upgrade Tornado.  Remove script-fixup stuff from the many scripty things Tornado installs

Default to new mirror address.
Allow the share location to be fixed.

Keep track of master/mirror in connection.
